definitions: To dress oneself in an item of clothing or accessory.
To start or cause a device or machine to operate.
To stage or present a performance, show, or act.
To apply something to a surface, such as makeup or lotion.
To pretend or feign something, often to deceive.
examples: She put on her coat before going outside.
Please put on the light; it's getting dark.
He's been putting on weight since he stopped exercising.
They're putting on a play next month.
Don't forget to put on sunscreen.
He was just putting on an act to get attention.
